ENS International Participant Email
Dear {!Contact.FirstName},
'Get more of what you want'
Please read the following information to help you get started for your ENS WLD Train the Trainer program on {!Job__c.Certificate_Date_Text__c} which will be run by {!Job__c.Facilitator_1__c}.
Location: The program will be held at {!Job__c.Venue_Name__c}, {!Job__c.Venue_Address__c}, {!Job__c.Venue_City__c} {!Job__c.Venue_State__c} {!Job__c.Venue_Postcode__c}, {!Job__c.Venue_Country__c}
Timing Currently we are planning to work from {!Job__c.Start_Finish_Time__c}, of course, this is subject to negotiation.
You should also be prepared to schedule around 1 to 1.5 hours each evening for assignments in preparation for the following day. The atmosphere of the workshop will be informal and you will be more than welcome in smart casual wear.
Pre-Program Requirements
Program Focus Questionnaire 'PFQ'- The PFQ helps the program leader to customise the program based on your needs. We ask that all PFQs are completed by {!Job__c.PFQ_Survey_due_date__c}. Click here to access the questionnaire. Note: This link is specific to you, please don't forward to others.
Pre-Reading To assist with the progress of the WLD, please ensure you are capable of making quick reference by page number to the content contained in the green ENS manual 'Professional Negotiation & Influencing'.
Please also bring this manual with you to this program.
Program Outline Focusing on workshop facilitation of the ENS negotiation and influencing methodology, topics typically covered during this WLD workshop include but are not limited to:
Adult learning and skills development Systematic consideration of the ENS philosophy & materials Needs assessment of participants and organizations Program design for specific situations Best practice faciliation and team-teaching techniques Experiential learning methods, including active role reversal Managing the learning environment Classroom control Handling the unexpected Individual tuition and supervised practice Generate strategic options Personal critiquing and evaluation of individual presentations
Program Materials At the commencement of the workshop, you will receive your personal copy of the Workshop Leader's Guide. Additional materials and handouts will be circulated during the workshop.
Should you have any questions, please feel free to contact me.
Kind regards
ENS International - Level 5, 83 York Street, Sydney 2000, NSW, Australia Phone: +61 2 9299 9688
